title: How many presidents have lost the popular vote but won the election? - Quora

response.answer_text: There have been five elections in which the winner did not get the most electoral votes. In one of them, the winner actually didn’t get the most popular votes or electoral votes. They are: 1824. Andrew Jackson got 41.4% of the popular vote to John Quincy Adams’ 30.9%. Jackson also got 99 electoral votes to Quincy Adams’ 84. But, since no one received a majority of the electoral votes (131 were needed to win), a contingent election was held in the House of Representatives. Henry Clay, very influential in the House, got enough votes for Quincy Adams, since he hated Jackson, and Quincy Adams won the election.1876: The most screwed up presidential election in history. I won’t go into details here, but there were questions about 20 electoral votes cast and Congress set up a special commission to determine what should be done with those votes. In the end, even though Samuel Tilden received the most popular votes (50.9% to Hayes’ 47.9%), Hayes got all 20 of the electoral votes in question, giving him a 185–184 electoral win. Tilden is the only presidential candidate to lose an election while getting a majority of the popular vote.1888: Incumbent president Grover Cleveland got more popular votes than Benjamin Harrison (48.6% to 47.8%), Harrison won the electoral vote 233–168. Four years later, Cleveland got revenge and beat Harrison in a rematch, returning Cleveland to the White House.2000. The “Florida hanging chad” election and the second most screwed up presidential election in history. Al Gore got 48.4% of the popular vote to George W. Bush’s 47.9%, Gore getting just a little over 500,000 more votes out of over 101 million cast. But, Bush got 271 electoral votes, one more than needed to win, over Gore’s 266.2016. Hillary Clinton got 48.2% of the popular vote to Donald Trump’s 46.1%. Trump won the electoral vote, though, 304–227.
